reviews.text:
I have loved EVERY SINGLE PLAY ON HAVE EVER SEEN HERE!!! 

Everyone involved is so amazing! 

GVT Jr. Is phenomenal! These kids are so passionate about their work! 

Go to GVT! You won't be disappointed!

Love this place. been active since I was 8, but have recently been on the other side of the stage and saw a whole bunch of shows. Bricktop was my favorite. never have seen or performed a bad show here at my second home.

Love this theater...not a bad seat in the house, super helpful and friendly staff, cash bar, clean bathrooms, and the plays are always amazing...this trip is a #christmastradition ..highly recommended!  Tonight we saw A Christmas Carol, last year we saw Babes in Toyland
Enjoyed the show. The theatre is wonderful for such a small town.

It's a nice theater. The course language in Honky-tonk Laundry was offensive to me and my group and I thought totally unnecessary. If I had been warned  about the language in the ad for the play I would not have attended. I'm glad I didn't bring my grandchildren. The actors and singing was very good. Wonder if the Author would consider writing a "G" version?

The staff was very helpful! We came from out of state to search for mid-1800 Greenbrier County ancestral vital records. They knew which records to pull, and where the record was stored. We wouldn't have gotten nearly as much done without their help. Thank you!
I have a lot of Family history in Lewisburg and I have good memories of visiting this place.
Awesome history, very friendly people, and interesting stories.
Thank you Joe for taking the time to show me around and give me a wonderful and informative tour. This is one of those places that's a real treat.
What a wonderful well maintained old brick house full of very interesting items. Well worth a vist.

The staff was very helpful! We came from out of state to search for mid-1800 Greenbrier County ancestral vital records. They knew which records to pull, and where the record was stored. We wouldn't have gotten nearly as much done without their help. Thank you!
I have a lot of Family history in Lewisburg and I have good memories of visiting this place.
Awesome history, very friendly people, and interesting stories.
Thank you Joe for taking the time to show me around and give me a wonderful and informative tour. This is one of those places that's a real treat.
What a wonderful well maintained old brick house full of very interesting items. Well worth a vist.
We were visitors and were very well received. Friendly church. Personable and capable pastor.
such a wonderful Church
Penus

Great place to relax.  Very quiet, friendly staff. Nice walking trail. Saw lots of wildlife!  Cabin we stayed in was perfect for 2, but it was rated for 4-- Can't imagine it bc of the lack of space- one dresser, no shelves or hooks.  The heat lamp in the bathroom was a plus, BUT be prepared!  The later in the season, or to put it plainly, the colder it is, you better know how to light a good fire!! They were putting a new roof on the unit across from us; I spoke to one of the rangers who said they were upgrading the cabins with mini split units AC/heaters...that will be a great upgrade!

Great park and great Disc golf course. I play here every year and it is a fun. The front nine is out in the open and the back nine is in the forrest. We usually play them reverse because we play later in the evening and it is lighter later in the open area. I want to camp here the cabins look fun

Excellent place to rent a cabin and be outside. There are many trails to explore, places to have campfires, and the staff are all nice and friendly. The weekend that I stayed it was very quiet and nice.

Wonderful park with much to do. Beautiful campground in natural setting, upgraded bathhouse with HOT water!
Between Historical Lewisburg an White Sulphur Springs.
Clean, friendly staff, and easy to get to ~
Hunting, Hiking, Camping.....just a couple miles from the world famous Greenbrier Resort.
Get there really early during on-season hours. Pastry and bagels go quick! My favorite stop for muffins and scones while vacationing in Charlestown area!! Great Staff! Patron since 2015.
Great products and services. Gorgeous gal at the register! Win win win

Lovely little bakery! The staff is super friendly and the baked goods are top notch! I got a raspberry almond muffin - and as a muffin connoisseur - I can tell you it’s in the the top 3 on my list. Would go back— and pick up a dozen! (Stellar coffee too!)
Food is fresh . Customer service stellar.  Coffee baristas brew good coffee.
Good food. Amazing iced coffee!

Picked up some take out. I had the Mongolian Beef with steamed rice and hot & sour soup. The soup was delicious and on the spicy side. Rice was nice and fluffy and I asked for a little cup of the “red sweet/sour sauce” as I like to put it on the rice. They were happy to accommodate my request.
The Mongolian Beef was outstanding! It was still piping hot when I opened the carton at home. The meat was tender and full of flavor. Best I’ve had in town. Will definitely order from them again.

I have a very mixed opinion of this place. Im giving three stars only because the food is always great, fresh, etc which is why I keep going back. HOWEVER, the service in house is subpar. Staff always seems frustrated that you are there and it takes FOREVER to get your food. So only go if you are not in a hurry to be anywhere soon. As far as calling in, good luck. That’s hit or miss. Some days I can get an answer and other days I never am able to get anyone to pick up the phone, and yes- I am calling during their funky business hours. Also, if you call in, still expect it to take at least 30 minutes or more for your food to be ready to be picked up.
Food not to bad.
We love this place. Been following that s business for over 20 years.
Nice Thai food, and inexpensive.

I always look forward to their delicious BBQ when they come to our local fair in Halifax County VA.  This year was no different.  I bought a SOBO potato, a pulled pork plate, 1/2 chicken, and 1/2 slab of ribs.  All of it was delicious.  I hope that they continue their success and visit us again.

We love BBQ, but we weren't sure what to expect in WV (we are from OK/TX).  It was really good!  I got a "barbecuban" sandwich that was absolutely fantastic!  Wish we lived closer so we could visit again!
Great loaded baked potato at Halifax Co. VA fair. Covered with pulled BBQ.
Some of the best we've ever had. Nice selection of choices, friendly staff,  and homemade sauces to top it off. If you're anywhere near it's today worth going to.
Food was great. I love that they're mobile.

It's a touch of class, nestled at the entrance of a warm and inviting town. When everything around us is changing rapidly, The General Lewis has always been a place to take us back in time. I'm a bit biased, I used to be the bellhop in 1977 before enlisting in the service, sitting on that stool, peering out the window to greet the next welcome visitor. I always stop back in when visiting home and that stool is still there. It's transformed a bit, upgraded here, and a bit there, but still has the same warm and inviting environment, great food and a staff dedicated to making your stay a pleasant one.

The restaurant is great for Sunday brunch! They have bloody marys, mimosas, and an extensive brunch menu in addition to their regular brunch menu. Our party of 5 each got something different, and we all enjoyed our food! Bonus points for real tablecloths, historic building, pleasant waiters and waitresses, and good coffee. They also list the Farmers they source from with a little bit of info on each in their menu. Love it!

Quaint,  friendly.   Excellent bedding.   Small baths.  Lovely bar. Easy walk to town / restaurants. We found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. Basic continental breakfast,  good coffee.

Very nice weekend getaway! But beware of the thin walls. We received a note on our door letting us know that the entire hotel heard the live performance of our afternoon delight. Can’t say that felt very welcoming, but the place was quaint with great atmosphere. The bartenders were fabulous and the breakfast was spectacular.
Fantastic brunch on the porch.   I can't wait to do it again.

Ordered a 16inch Pep and Mushroom and Extra Cheese Pizza and was excellent!  Crust was just right, the red sauce was delicious!  Friendly staff and a great location on Jefferson Street in the heart of town!

I had the smoked garlic and parmesan chicken wings which were delicious. I also had the soup of the day which was potato kale soup which was sort of a tomato soup with hearty chunks of potatoes and kale and onion. The meal was great on this cold evening.
Shop local, eat local and fresh! Great pizza!

Applied twice for a job here. Got turned down both times because they didn’t “need people” saw a sign in the front window today saying how they needed people to work the front. Went in asked about it and was told “we already have enough workers” I’m a fairly polite person and usually don’t take stuff like this to heart but this is ridiculous. Why turn someone down for a job multiple times if you need more workers.
Their white Greek pizza is amazing!
Fantastic Service! Best hometown corner grille ever! Staff is friendly and food is great! The owner has a great assortment of collectibles on display
First time dining at Rudy's. Had the homemade chicken salad sandwich, it was delicious. Loved the atmosphere and our waitress Reba was super nice and friendly.  Will definitely go back.
English hot dogs were pretty good they hit the spot and the sweet tea was real good.

Great home cookin!

The staff were all super nice people, the food was very good.

I had the Sunday lunch buffet and the fried chicken and ribs were fall off the bone delicious.
Great food, home cooked,  reasonable prices.

This market was unique and very cute to all through. I feel like they have too many homemade weaves basket vendors (in my opinion there could be other, different shops in place). The Shea Butter store was really cool, I enjoyed learning the history and origin of the Shea Butter that was imported from Africa. It’s nice seeing the product in its raw form rather than in a bottle in a store aisle. Very cool!

The Market is on our list every time we visit Charleston. It's bustling and right in the center of historic downtown. Tons of vendors offer a wide variety of local products and the food options are great. Our go-to Market snack are Callie's Hot Little Biscuits, which are out of this world. I love that there is a clean public restroom inside.

Bring your walking shoes and experience local artisans, bakers, woodworkers --and merchandise resellers! Sift from booth to booth to discover some real local crafting. Many resellers offer the same merchandise priced at outrageously different prices. So if you see something you thought you'd never see again at a fair price, keep walking... You'll probably find it for half its price a few booths from there. This market sits at the heart of historical Charleston, and you can walk to rainbow row, the Battery and other key free attractions within minutes. Convenient public bathrooms are located at this market.

A plethora of quality hand crafted creations. The sea grass baskets are well made and many designs available.
 Beautiful paintings are reasonably priced. Sterling jewelry selections are abundant.

The place is very busy but it's a tourist attraction, lots and lots of history good to know and learn. The sights are beautiful the water is too. It is very family oriented, lots of things to see and do, everyone is nice! Kinda pricey but it's an attraction so don't expect to be cheap but you can enjoy the place and learn too

I'm a bit biased, I used to be the bellhop in 1977 before enlisting in the service, sitting on that stool, peering out the window to greet the next welcome visitor. It's transformed a bit, upgraded here, and a bit there, but still has the same warm and inviting environment, great food and a staff dedicated to making your stay a pleasant one.
